Class MenuBars

  • Object
    • Component
      • Container
        • Window
          • Frame
            • MenuBars
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Component>, Bindable, Sequence<Component>, ConstrainedVisual, Visual

    public class MenuBars
extends Frame
implements Bindable
    Class that represents the menu bar for non-dialog windows.

    The required functionality is not built in to Pivot, because of the need to create named actions that are driven from the menu items.

    Full disclosure: the template for this class was gleefully stolen from the Pivot tutorials :)

    Author:
    Jon

    • Constructor Detail

      • MenuBars

        public MenuBars()
        Class constructor. This creates named actions for the following menu items:
        • File -> Open
        • File -> Save
        • File -> Exit
        • Edit -> Preferences

    • Method Detail

      • initializeMenuBxmlVariables

        public void initializeMenuBxmlVariables(BXMLSerializer windowSerializer,
                                        List<Component> components,
                                        boolean showFileSave)
        Initializes the BXML variables and data for the menu bar that appears on all primary windows.
        Parameters:
        windowSerializer - BXML serializer used to read the window BXML file
        components - list of window components that is extended with menu bar components
        showFileSave - flag that indicates whether or not to show the File -> Save menu item

      • initialize

        public void initialize(Map<String,Object> namespace,
                       URL location,
                       Resources resources)
        Initializes the class after it has been completely processed and bound by the serializer. This method is required to be overriden for the Bindable interface, but does nothing.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface Bindable
        Parameters:
        namespace - serializer's namespace
        location - location of the BXML source
        resources - resources used to localize the deserialized content, or null
